page.title: 14TRANSPORT:WASHINGTON/FELLING
page.content: The{Northern General Transport Company in Tyne and Wear operates around 41 {bus services,}with 103 1 man operators. The buses travel approximately 36000 miles per week. The 5p fare for under 16's will not be abolished as yet, but it may be in the future along with the pensioners' pass. There is not a set fare for each stop but there is a {price }for each zone. The bus service integrates with the Tyne & Wear{metro system. There is a regular bus service to{ {Heworth metro station. In a survey of 57 people 62% said they were happy with public transport. {Suggestions for improvement}included increasing the number of buses and punctuality. 19 people said they used public transport everyday, 29 every week and 4 never; 33 people had bus passes.
